sen.j: 宇治上神社 （うじがみじんじゃ）は、京都府宇治市にある神社。
sen.e: Ujigami-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Uji City, Kyoto City.
Ujigami-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Uji City, Kyoto City.
Ujigami-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 日本の世界遺産「古都京都の文化財」の構成要素。
sen.e: It is designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site as one of the 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto'.
It is designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site as one of the 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto'.
It is designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site as one of the 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を移動

sen.j: 菟道稚郎子命（うじのわきのいらつこのみこと）・応神天皇・仁徳天皇を祀る。
sen.e: It enshrines Uji no Waki no Iratsuko no Mikoto, Emperor Ojin and Emperor Nintoku.
It enshrines Uji no Waki no Iratsuko no Mikoto, Emperor Ojin and Emperor Nintoku.
It enshrines Uji no Waki no Iratsuko no Mikoto, Emperor Ojin and Emperor Nintoku.
It is a counterpart of Uji-jinja Shrine.
It is a counterpart of Uji-jinja Shrine.
It is a counterpart of Uji-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 創建年代などの起源ははっきりしていない。
sen.e: Both the time of the shrine's founding and the details of its origin are clear.
Both the time of the shrine's founding and the details of its origin are clear.
Both the time of the shrine's founding and the details of its origin are clear.

sen.j: すぐ近くに宇治神社があり、明治維新前は両方を合わせて宇治離宮明神、八幡社と呼ばれ、宇治神社を下社・若宮とするのに対して、宇治上神社は上社・本宮と呼ばれている。
sen.e: It stands close to Uji-jinja Shrine and before the Meiji Restoration both formed Uji Rikyu Myojin Shrine known as Hachiman-sha Shrine of which Uji-jingu Shrine comprised the lower sub-shrine while Ujigami-jinja Shrine was known as the upper main shrine.

It stands close to Uji-jinja Shrine and before the Meiji Restoration both formed Uji Rikyu Myojin Shrine known as Hachiman-sha Shrine of which Uji-jingu Shrine comprised the lower sub-shrine while Ujigami-jinja Shrine was known as the upper main shrine.

It stands close to Uji-jinja Shrine and before the Meiji Restoration both formed Uji Rikyu Myojin Shrine known as Hachiman-sha Shrine of which Uji-jinja Shrine comprised the lower sub-shrine while Ujigami-jinja Shrine was known as the upper main shrine.
sen.cmt: Uji-jingu Shrine→Uji-jinja Shrineに修正、余分なスペース消去

sen.j: 「延喜式神名帳」には「山城国宇治郡 宇治神社二座」とあり、それぞれ宇治神社・宇治上神社を指している。
sen.e: The Jinmyocho (list of deities and shrines) of the Engishiki (book or regulations of the Engi era) refers to Uji-jinja Shrine and Ujigami-jinja Shrine as 'the two Uji-jinja Shrines in Uji County, Yamashiro Province'.

The Jinmyocho (list of deities and shrines) of the Engishiki (book or regulations of the Engi era) refers to Uji-jinja Shrine and Ujigami-jinja Shrine as 'the two Uji-jinja Shrines in Uji County, Yamashiro Province'.

The 'Jinmyocho (list of deities and shrines) of the Engishiki' (book or regulations of the Engi era) refers to Uji-jinja Shrine and Ujigami-jinja Shrine as 'the two Uji-jinja Shrines in Uji County, Yamashiro Province.'
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせクォーテーション追加、ピリオドの位置を移動

sen.j: 近くに平等院ができるとその鎮守社とされた。
sen.e: When construction of the nearby Byodo-in Temple was completed, these shrines came to serve as its guardian shrines.
When construction of the nearby Byodo-in Temple was completed, these shrines came to serve as its guardian shrines.
When construction of the nearby Byodo-in Temple was completed, these shrines came to serve as its guardian shrines.

sen.j: 2004年2月、奈良文化財研究所・宇治市などの年輪年代測定調査によれば、本殿は1060年ごろのものとされ、現存最古の神社建築であることが裏付けられるとともに、1052年創建の平等院との深い関連性が考えられる。
sen.e: In February 2004, dendrochronological studies conducted by the Nara Research Institute for Cultural Properties and Uji City dated the main sanctuary to around 1060, making it the oldest surviving piece of Shinto shrine architecture, and leading to the belief that it has a deep connection to Byodo-in Temple which was founded in 1052.

In February 2004, dendrochronological studies conducted by the Nara Research Institute for Cultural Properties and Uji City dated the main sanctuary to around 1060, making it the oldest surviving piece of Shinto shrine architecture, and leading to the belief that it has a deep connection to Byodo-in Temple which was founded in 1052.

In February 2004, dendrochronological studies conducted by the Nara Research Institute for Cultural Properties and Uji City dated the main sanctuary to around 1060, making it the oldest surviving piece of Shinto shrine architecture, and leading to the belief that it has a deep connection to Byodo-in Temple which was founded in 1052.

sen.j: 現存最古とされる平安時代後期の本殿が残っている（外から見えるのは覆屋で、中に本殿が3つ並んでいる）。
sen.e: The main sanctuary dating from the latter part of the Heian period is believed to be the oldest surviving example of such a building (a cover building can be seen from outside and inside stand three sanctuary buildings).

The main sanctuary dating from the latter part of the Heian period is believed to be the oldest surviving example of such a building (a cover building can be seen from outside and inside stand three sanctuary buildings).

The main sanctuary dating from the latter part of the Heian period is believed to be the oldest surviving example of such a building (a cover building can be seen from outside and inside stand three sanctuary buildings).

sen.j: 拝殿は鎌倉時代前期の宇治離宮を移築したものといわれ、寝殿造の趣きを伝えている。
sen.e: The worship hall which dates from the first part of the Kamakura period and is said to have been relocated from Uji Rikyu (Uji Imperial Villa) retains a shinden-zukuri style.
The worship hall which dates from the first part of the Kamakura period and is said to have been relocated from Uji Rikyu (Uji Imperial Villa) retains a shinden-zukuri style.
The worship hall which dates from the first part of the Kamakura period and is said to have been relocated from Uji Rikyu (Uji Imperial Villa) retains a shinden-zukuri style.

sen.j: 境内にある湧き水は桐原水と呼ばれ、宇治七名水の一つとされている。
sen.e: The natural spring that emerges within the precinct is called 'Kirihara Mizu) and is one of the Seven Great Springs of Uji.
The natural spring that emerges within the precinct is called 'Kirihara Mizu) and is one of the Seven Great Springs of Uji.
The natural spring that emerges within the precincts is called Kirihara Mizu) and is one of the Seven Great Springs of Uji.
sen.cmt: precinct→precinctsとし、不要なクォーテーション削除

sen.e: Main sanctuary
Main sanctuary

Worship hall

sen.j: 宇治市槙島町の氏子が5月5日の本祭を執り行う。
sen.e: The shrine parishioners of Makishima-machi, Uji City hold an annual festival on 5th April.
The shrine parishioners of Makishima-machi, Uji City hold an annual festival on 5th April.
The shrine parishioners of Makishima-machi, Uji City hold an annual festival on May 5.
